org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.annotations

Annotation Type IndividualUri


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface IndividualUri
    Annotates a field to be used as a resource identifier for an OWL individual. Each Java class annotated as a OwlIndividual is expected to have exactly one field annotated with @IndividualUri.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static Class<? extends java.util.function.Function> DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION
      Class constant identifying the default transformation function.
      static String TRANSFORM
      String constant identifying the annotation attribute transform().
      static String TRANSFORM_MODE
      String constant identifying the annotation attribute mode().

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      TransformMode mode
      The transformation mode.
      Class<? extends java.util.function.Function<Object,String>> transform
      A function that transforms the value of the annotated field, provided the value of the field.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION

        public static final Class<? extends java.util.function.Function> DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION
        Class constant identifying the default transformation function.

      • TRANSFORM

        public static final String TRANSFORM
        String constant identifying the annotation attribute transform(). Useful when using this annotation with the Java Reflection API.

      • TRANSFORM_MODE

        public static final String TRANSFORM_MODE
        String constant identifying the annotation attribute mode(). Useful when using this annotation with the Java Reflection API.

    • Element Detail

      • transform

        public abstract Class<? extends java.util.function.Function<Object,String>> transform
        A function that transforms the value of the annotated field, provided the value of the field.

        This is useful when the value of annotated field needs to be manipulated prior to being converted to RDF. For example, assume that id in the following class contains the string form of a URL: 

         @OwlIndividual
 public class MyDomainClass {
   @IndividualUri
   String id;
 }

        The resulting RDF model would create a resource such as: 

         <http://mydomain/object/1234> a owl:Thing ;
   # ...
   # other predicates
   # ...
   .

        What if you wanted the RDF to relativize the resource identifier like so: 

         <1234> a owl:Thing ;
   # ...
   # other predicates
   # ...
   .
        You would annotate the @IndividualUri with this transform attribute, specifying a Function that accepts the value of the annotated field (in this example http://mydomain/object/1234) and transforms it to the desired value (e.g 1234).
        Returns:
        the Class of a Function responsible for transforming the value of the field, provided the value of the field, to a String
        Default:
        org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.support.ToStringTransform.class

      • mode

        public abstract TransformMode mode
        The transformation mode.

        A mode of TransformMode.FIELD means that the value of the annotated field will be supplied to the transform function. A mode of TransformMode.CLASS means that the instance of the class enclosing the annotated field will be supplied to the transform function.

        Returns:
        the mode of the transformation function; whether it is accepting an instance of the annotated field or an instance of the class enclosing the annotated field
        Default:
        org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.annotations.TransformMode.FIELD
